Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Meruliaceae with descriptions of
two new species from China
Keywords:
diversity, macrofungi, phylogenetic analysis, two new
taxa, wood-rotting fungi
Abstract:
Two new wood-inhabiting fungi Hermanssonia xxx sp. nov.
and Phlebia yyy sp. nov in the family Meruliaceae are described and
illustrated from China (Tibet and Yunnan Province) based on molecular
and morphological evidence. The characteristics of Hermanssonia xxx
include annual, resupinate basidioma, a monomitic hyphal system, and
oblong ellipsoid basidiospores that are 56 × 2.43 μm. The basidioma of
H. xxx changes drastically on drying, from being a light-coloured, very
juicy fruitbody with a very papillose and wrinkled surface, to
dark-coloured, more or less smooth. The characteristics of Phlebia yyy
include annual, resupinate basidioma with clay-buff dry aculei, 23
aculei per mm, a monomitic hyphal system, tubular cystidia measuring
2025 × 33.5 µm, and oblong ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 4.45.2 ×
2.13 μm. The phylogenetic analyses based on the combined 2-locus dataset
[ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS) + nuclear large subunit RNA (nLSU)] confirm the
placement of two new species respectively in Hermanssonia and Phlebia.
Phylogenetically closely related species to the two new species are
discussed.
